adrFormatAddress: 870 7th Ave 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10019-4369, USA

originalText.text:
Incident at Hampton, Sedona,

When an unfortunate incident happens, sometimes the way its handled by a manager can change the outcome and leave the guest feeling like the business cares.  This wasn’t the outcome regarding a stay at the Hampton in Sedona on April 19th. As you may know all the guests were evacuated that morning and had to leave before many of them had planned. We all understand accidents can happen, even when they are caused by someone’s irresponsible actions. The reason for this message is to bring to light the actions of the manager at this location Danielle Sonn. When I reached out after receiving my bill for the hotel stay, and was charged for a full stay, no reduction as noted by hotel staff the day of the incident. When I first spoke with Mrs. Sonn on 4/24/23 she was defensive of the hotels stance of not reducing the night’s stay, and if I wasn’t happy, I should contact customer service, which I did numerus times (see attachment with thread) The going back and forth with guest services went on for a couple month, and at no time did guest services forward my message to the hotel or to High Gate. On 6/15/23 I received a reply from guest services with an email address from the hotel which forwarded the thread requesting feedback on my concerns.  It appears the contact address was for an employee of Mrs. Sonn’s and she replied in a very inappropriate manner. The part of having my profile flagged as if this has ever happened before really set me off.   I asked Mrs. Sonn following my last call on 6/21/23 who she reported to, she said she only reports to Hilton and if I had issues with her to contact them, as we can see this isn’t who she works for and her reluctance to be honest further irritates me to reach out to you. The hospitality business doesn’t need people who won’t do the right thing, and this as you know will negatively impact your brand. I would like some type of reply letting me know you have received my message. With Mrs. Sonn in the early stages of her career in hotel management she needs an adjustment in the way she engages with the people your company empowered her to care for.
Please share this message with Dave Mahan, operations manager for Arizona.

originalText.text: I am writing this review about the West house Hotel.  I have been a guest here several times and I must say what I witnessed on my last stay left me astonished. They were a gentleman and a young woman working at the front desk and it seems like they were having a very difficult time due to an overwhelming amount of guest checking in at the same time, They maintained such a positive and calm attitude and the concierge  even gave us and other  guest water while we waited. She was very apologetic and welcoming.  The next day while sitting in the lobby area I witnessed another front desk personnel rudely yelling at the concierge in front of all the guests.   The young lady handled it with such grace and I could clearly see she was embarrassed.  When I returned home this did not settle well with my conscience because I said nothing.  I regret not getting the persons name and this is unacceptable behavior from one individual to another.    For such a distinguished hotel, they can do better. I hope that whomever is in change sees this and implement some changes. The Concierge deserves an apology and some form of recognition for her handling the situation delicately, I truly regret not getting her name.

originalText.text: I had a sudden sepsis death that occurred right after a shift. The manager Josh Messer responded by having his employees harass me and also throw a party since he's so happy that I died

text.text: I had a sudden sepsis death that occurred right after a shift. The manager Josh Messer responded by having his employees harass me and also throw a party since he's so happy that I died

originalText.text: Booked a room for my son in NY, NY at a Hilton property, and Highgate, the franchise owner of the property, calls me at midnight, and says I need to complete a "guarantee of payment" form before my son can check-in.  What a joke!  As a Hilton Diamond member, I have booked him rooms across the U.S. and never had this happen.  #highgatestinks
